body: @kchibisov You mentioned stuff like xdotool vs other tools in the past. Seems like the same issue?
Yeah, pretty much. It just seems like you can't solely use xkbcommon on X11.

@kchibisov
>A - needs repro

I've already provided reproduction steps and logs. Were they insufficient?
If so, please let me know what exactly is needed so I can provide more information.
It doesn't mean that I can repro, but autokey requires special treatment.

Using Arch Linux, X11, dwm, and KeePassXC 2.7.6, and Alacritty 0.13.1, I have no trouble letting KeePassXC auto-type capital letters into Alacritty, including if I follow the reproduction steps to the letter.

Arch Linux, Alacritty v0.13.1-1, autokey 0.96.0-4

Same problem: phrase expansion of special characters is messed up:

`:` gets expanded as `;`
`_` gets expanded as `-`

issue.title: xdotool fails to recognize alacritty window
issue.body:
My keybind to resize windows fails with alacritty (works fine with other windows like chromium or slack). When debugging the issue, I found out that xdtool fails to recognized the alacritty window.

```console
$ xdotool getactivewindow
XGetWindowProperty[_NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW] failed (code=1)
xdo_get_active_window reported an error
```

Any idea why this this happening, how to debug it further and hopefully resolve it ?


For context, on ubuntu gnome, we have bindings like Super+Up to resize windows, but it only works on landscape screens and I have a portrait monitor. I wrote a script to handle resizing depending on the screen presentation mode. Without the script, ubuntu gnome (Mutter?)'s default keybinding worked fine with alacritty too.

### System

OS: Linux 6.1.0-1028-oem
Version: `alacritty 0.12.3 (5efb0690)`
Linux/BSD: Ubuntu Gnome ~Wayland~ X11

### Logs

<summary>alacritty -vv</summary>
